intro: Becium hirtii, commonly known as the hairy becium, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive crown-like structure. Becium hirtii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
